### TABLEDATA

CREATE TABLE customers (
    customer_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    first_name VARCHAR(50),
    last_name VARCHAR(50),
    email VARCHAR(100),
    phone_number VARCHAR(20)
);

CREATE TABLE transactions (
    transaction_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    customer_id INT REFERENCES customers(customer_id),
    transaction_date TIMESTAMP,
    amount DECIMAL(10,2),
    product_name VARCHAR(100)
);

### STATEMENT

UPDATE customers SET first_name='John', last_name='Doe' WHERE customer_id=1;

CREATE TABLE customers (
    customer_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    first_name VARCHAR(50),
    last_name VARCHAR(50),
    email VARCHAR(100),
    phone_number VARCHAR(20)
);

CREATE TABLE transactions (
    transaction_id INT PRIMARY KEY,

### STATEMENT

UPDATE customers SET email = 'newemail@example.com', phone_number = '555-555-5555' WHERE customer_id IN (SELECT customer_id FROM transactions WHERE amount > 1000.00);

### TABLEDATA

CREATE TABLE customers (
  customer_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  customer_name VARCHAR(255),
  email VARCHAR(255),
  phone_number VARCHAR(20),
  address VARCHAR(255),
  registration_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE transactions (
  transaction_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  customer_id INT,
  transaction_date DATE,
  total_amount DECIMAL(10, 2),
  payment_method VARCHAR(50),
  FOREIGN KEY (customer_id) REFERENCES customers(customer_id)
)

CREATE TABLE preferences (
  preference_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  customer_id INT,
  preference_name VARCHAR(100),
  preference_value VARCHAR(255),
  FOREIGN KEY (customer_id) REFERENCES customers(customer_id)
)

CREATE TABLE logs (
  log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  log_date DATETIME,
  log_type VARCHAR(50),
  description TEXT
)

### STATEMENT

UPDATE customers SET email = 'newemail@example.com' WHERE customer_id = 1;

### TABLEDATA

CREATE TABLE customers (
    customer_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(50),
    email VARCHAR(100),
    phone_number VARCHAR(20)
);

CREATE TABLE transactions (
    transaction_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    customer_id INT,
    amount DECIMAL(10,2),
    transaction_date TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (customer_id) REFERENCES customers(customer_id)
);

CREATE TABLE products (
    product_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(50),
    category VARCHAR(50),
    price DECIMAL(10,2)
);

CREATE TABLE preferences (
    customer_id INT,
    product_id INT,
    preference_score INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (customer_id) REFERENCES customers(customer_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (product_id) REFERENCES products(product_id)
);

CREATE TABLE recommendations (
    customer_id INT,
    product_id INT,
    recommendation_score INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (customer_id) REFERENCES customers(customer_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (product_id) REFERENCES products(product_id)
);

### STATEMENT

UPDATE customers SET email='new_email@example.com' WHERE customer_id=1
